      • getExecutorService

        public com.google.common.util.concurrent.ListeningExecutorService getExecutorService()
        Description copied from interface: Service.Instance
        Returns a shared ListeningExecutorService that has virtually infinite capacity and that can be used for long-running jobs. This executor is scoped along with the service instance, which avoids the need to use the very problematic daemon threads.
        Specified by:
        getExecutorService in interface Service.Instance
        Returns:
        A shared ListeningExecutorService.

      • getScheduledExecutorService

        public com.google.common.util.concurrent.ListeningScheduledExecutorService getScheduledExecutorService()
        Description copied from interface: Service.Instance
        Returns a shared ListeningScheduledExecutorService that has capacity appropriate for scheduled jobs, i.e. jobs that run periodically and have a limited execution time. Use Service.Instance.getExecutorService() for jobs that run forever. This executor is scoped along with the service instance, which avoids the need to use the very problematic daemon threads.
        Specified by:
        getScheduledExecutorService in interface Service.Instance
        Returns:
        A shared ListeningScheduledExecutorService.

      • getCloser

        public com.google.common.io.Closer getCloser()
        Description copied from interface: Service.Instance
        Returns a Closer for convenience, where you can register Closeables that should be closed when the application exits.
        Specified by:
        getCloser in interface Service.Instance
        Returns:
        A Closer for convenience.

      • getSignaller

        public Service.Signaller getSignaller()
        Description copied from interface: Service.Instance
        Returns a signaller that can be used to send signals to this service instance. It can be used to send signals to a running service instance, but after the service instance has exited, sending signals will be no-ops.
        Specified by:
        getSignaller in interface Service.Instance
        Returns:
        a signaller that can be used to send signals to this service instance.

      • waitForShutdown

        public void waitForShutdown()
                     throws InterruptedException
        Description copied from interface: Service.Instance
        A method that will block until the service has stopped. This will wait until a signal from the environment tells the service to shutdown, or an error occurs.
        Specified by:
        waitForShutdown in interface Service.Instance
        Throws:
        InterruptedException

      • isShutdown

        public boolean isShutdown()
        Description copied from interface: Service.Instance
        Returns whether the service has gotten a shutdown signal, meaning that Service.Instance.waitForShutdown() will not block.
        Specified by:
        isShutdown in interface Service.Instance
        Returns:
        whether the service has gotten a shutdown signal.
